article:
For most, getting a car opens up a new world of freedom and allows you to go wherever you want. Getting a car did 31 _ this for me, and it also brought my best friend and me 32 _ . But then it tore us apart  .
My best friend lives three minutes from my 33 _ . Since her 34 _ is in late summer, seven months behind mine, I seemed to become her 35 _ when I turned 16 in December.
And so I 36 _ her up for school and took her home. We made ice-cream 37 _ , went shopping and to the movies--all in my car. I would drive to her house just to sit on her bed, read magazines and have a good laugh. I went to her house so 38 _ that she gave me a key 39 _  her house.
A week after I began to drive, she was with me40 _ I had my first accident. She was there and    _  me and we kept it a 42 _ , since I didn't want people to43 _ . From then on, through thick and thin  , it was just me, my car and my best friend.
High school is a time of 44 _ , but I couldn't45 _ for a long time 46 _ we became so distant. Finally, my friend got her dream car: a green 2004 Volkswagen New Beetle. With its    _  , the passenger seat of my car became48 _ . Our car trips became less frequent49 _ I didn't even drive down her street.
It's funny how a car can change a relationship so much. I had wanted her to get a car, but once she did, I 50 _  it. I wanted her friendship back, even if it couldn't be the same.
